name: Clift San Francisco Hotel

reviews.text: Typical of Morgan's hotels, there is nothing to complain about here. Great service from the moment you arrive until you leave, great design (modern, quiet and clean rooms). The Redwood Room bar should not be missed, and the Asia de Cuba restaurant is great as well. Located just off of Union Square in the theater district and convenient to BART.
reviews.title: Top notch hotel, great location, rooms and service.

reviews.text: Great hotel if you're looking for something different, and you like boutique hotels.
reviews.title: Unique hotel...great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon, did not enjoy it at all. Pleasing on the eye but very very dark during the day, no daylight. At night the bar fills up with locals, no where to sit down and have a quiet drink, a large amount of outside influence to this hotel. We found the room pleasent but extremely noisy. there was a baby staying across the corridor and we heard it crying the entire night, no sound proof in the walls what so ever. Good location, thats the only thing we enjoyed from our stay in the Clift. Won't be back.
reviews.title: Hip, noisy, unfriendly and packed

reviews.text: We stayed for three days and booked via American Express.
reviews.title: Give this one a try - great all round hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were great, bed and lien was super comfortable. Staff were knowledgeable and very helpful (unlike what some others have mentioned on TA).
reviews.title: Quite disappointing - not as great as other Morgans hotels

reviews.text: We stayed at the Clift Hotel for 5 days and enjoyed every minute of it. Check in was quick and easy and the rooms are very spacious. The bathroom is a little small and outdated, but otherwise fine. The reception desk and the concierge were always friendly, though sometimes a bit slow in making reservations for restaurants etc. All in all I would definitely stay here again. The location is great as you can walk to the major attractions.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were happy with the hotel until we found out that our credit card had been charged for $340 for a mini bar we had apparently cleaned out. This was not the case since we never even opened the minibar during our stay which lasted only from 11PM to 8AM. When we went to speak with the manager, we were made to wait in the hall for a long time and when the manager finally spoke with us, he did so in front of a lobby full of people and in a manner that was rude and defensive. Finally, we got our money back, but I would definitely not stay there in the future nor recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Bad customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is old with just a fresh coat of paint...the walls are SUPER thin (lets just say we knew EVERYTHING the neighbors were doing..) plus we could hear the base from club downstairs until 2-3AM...the bathrooms are impossibly small and being 8 months pregnant did not make it any easier! The rooms are small and not impressive...oh, and our room filled with cig smoke at 8AM...we could not get out of there quick enough (we left at 9AM....) We got a deal from hotwire but if I had spent the $200-300 they wanted I would have been [--]...
reviews.title: NEGATIVE, NEGATIVE, NEGATIVE

reviews.text: The other reports on here are fairly accurate.
reviews.title: Great public spaces, but average rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public spaces, restaurant and redwood rooms are great fun, especially the moving portraits in the bar. The rooms just about adequate with very little character, and even littler bathrooms. Food was good in the asia de cuba restaurants, and the cocktails were delicious in the redwood rooms.
reviews.title: An updated funky old hotel with very thin walls

reviews.text: Clift Hotel very stark with little warmth or ambiance. Rooms are small. Staff friendly and helpfull. Would not go back
reviews.title: Not thtat good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK. so why do they keep these Morgan places so dark?? The stylish lobby and the bar are almost over done...the location is good (but on the edges), the rooms are indeed small, the views narrow airshafts and dull brick buildings...(higher floors excepted)...the rooms designed for photographs, but not living in, there are NO drawers...NONE, if using desk, can't get by to rest of room, small tv, and the worst, the smallest bathrooms I've met, with too much furniture in odd locations, we moved ours into room..better, no relaxing soaks in the mini tub either...
reviews.title: Smallest bathroom....

likes.disliked: — tiny ill designed bathrooms, DARK and cramped

reviews.text: There are, however, redeeming aspects: the bar is great, the restaurant is good, the beds are super and the staff in particular accomodating and helpful...the place is well kept and very clean.
reviews.title: Ridiculously overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we stay again, well we were in a Superior rm 315 sq ft king sleigh bed tub and shower dvd cd high ceiling room...if we had the $$$ the suites are fun and interesting and the big suite (the apartment) is GREAT...
reviews.title: Excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, I'll try another place next trip...at $300+ per night...there has to be a better place
reviews.title: Pass on this hotel

reviews.text: I just came back from a 6 night stay in SF. I stayed at the Clift Hotel and I must say I am completely delighted. Everyone was nice, the doormen were always there to open the doors, give suggestions as to places to go, etc. I read reviews saying this place was full of rude people and I must say I do not agree. I did not encounter one rude person in this hotel nor in SF!! The Redwood Bar was awesome, drinks are pricey, but I'm from Miami where that is the normal price, so I wasn't surprised. I loved the whole atmosphere with the hotel, so chic, so trendy. I also read about the rooms being small and I will disagree again, not at all small. I got the standard room with two double beds and there was plenty of space. Who cares that there is no drawers, who really unpacks their stuff while on vacay. If things like that bother you, then I can see why this hotel is not to your liking. I didn't get a chance to eat at Asia de Cuba but I have eaten at the Miami location and it is excellent food! Location wise, this is the best place to be, so close to so many diff places and all within walking distance. Westfield Mall is a huge mall about 5 blocks away. Macy's, Saks and all the fine boutiques are also nearby. There's a Walgreens across the street as a well a Starbucks and a deli (david's deli). I would gladly go back to this hotel.
reviews.title: The Best in Union Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a chance to stay at the Clift recently, hotel was amazing with a great view of downtown SF. The staff was great, everyone from the valet to the front-desk were extremely helpful and made me feel very much at home.
reviews.title: great place to enjoy SF

reviews.text: I enjoyed an incredible stay at Clift while in SF for 1-night on business. The room was great, bed was comfortable and service was fast and attentive. I also had the fortunate experience of dining at Asia de Cuba for an amazing wine event. Overall stay was excellent and would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a very funky and modern hotel, which we loved staying in.....
reviews.title: Funky Modern Contempory hotel

reviews.text: We got to the hotel and was greeted by the gentlemen on the door which was opened for us every time we went in and out of the hotel which was fab
reviews.title: yep tendance but to know before: tendance doesn't mean the perfection

reviews.text: We, a family of 4, have stayed at the Clift regularly for 3 years and greatly enjoyed its location, decor, and friendly staff. This March I tried to make a reservation to stay in our favorite suite and I was told that they do not and have never allowed 4 people to stay together in a suite. The reservations agent continued to insist that this was true even when I told her we had stayed there numerous times in the past and that she could look this up in her records. I asked if it were possible to take two rooms or two adjoining rooms. She made no effort to be helpful or explain the situation or call for a manager. I am appalled they would treat any potential guest with this attitude, much less a previous customer. We will not try again. I am writing this review 3 months later because it still irks me!
reviews.title: Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just spent three days at the Clift and found the experience mixed.
reviews.title: Mixed.

likes.disliked: — The dark rooms with little storage.

reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: What happens fashion designersma

reviews.text: 1. Location--can't be beat.
reviews.title: Never a dull moment at the Clift

likes.liked: — They upgraded my room and gave me drink vouchers for my b-day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Front desk crew--helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: The Clift is OVER RATED!

reviews.text: This place tries to be cool; the experience was definitely cold, and unless you are a gorgeous looking model or a rock star, don't expect any service.
reviews.title: What a Snotty Attitude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first experience was at the front desk. My son had secured the reservation with a credit card. The receptionist insisted she had to have the card holder present; I offered a debit card and suggested she take the first night, and we could straighten it out when my son came. She turned her nose up and said she would have to take $900 out of the card for our three night stay up front. After I called my son, they said 'it would be alright, as long as he came later." Don't expect any friendliness, or the staff to point out amenities, or ask if you need a wake up call, or anything else.
reviews.title: Choose another hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public spaces including the reception and waiting areas are very dark in monochromatic dark red.The room was very chic with lots of mirrors to make it look larger, but so small that there was approx 18 inches between the bed and the wall; the hallway so dark we couldn't see our clothes in the closet, and there were no drawers.
reviews.title: Great vibe, but maybe a little too club-ish! Tiny rooms......

reviews.text: My son had negotiated a very low rate, so I cannot complain about the cost. My sister and her husband had a suite which was very nice, but cost three times as much.No amenities in the room such as coffee. They serve free coffee until 7:00 a.m. When we asked for coffee at 7:05 we were told the charge was $5 a cup. Use the Starbucks across the street.
reviews.title: Calm and relaxing hotel with great design
So much style - but not in bathrooms and service
reviews.text: We were disappointed with the Clift from the moment that we arrived. We found the door staff to be unwelcoming, reception to be understaffed and the communal areas a little seedy in appearance. Our room was fairly spacious and clean, although furniture and bathroom looked cheap. The leaking loo flusher added to the bathroom's failings. We were glad to leave after 3 nights to a far superior hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located hip hotel with good rooms but not great bathrooms. Strangely there is no art on the walls and therefore rooms can feel quite sparse/cold. Be aware the hotel is big and therefore the customer service is not as good as it could be – no one helped with our baggage on both our stays and you feel like you are being processed through as opposed to being really looked after.
reviews.title: Good but not Great

reviews.text: This is a gorgeous hotel. The staff is excellent, with some of the nicest, courteous and most professional people that I have encountered in a long while. The decorations in my room were beautiful! Also, the lobby is out of this world, with an over sized chair and fireplace that are very fun and inviting.
reviews.title: Beautifully appointed, wonderfully staffed
Right in the center of the action
reviews.text: The hotel boasts a great club/lounge/restaurant that seems to have all the beautiful people in San Francisco grace it's doors.

One quibble however. Housekeeping knocks on doors at 8 am. You can hear them in the hallway knocking away until they make it to your room. I had to request that they not knock before 10 am. But that is a small gripe for such a wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Overpriced and Underpar

reviews.text: We stayed at the Clift for one night on a Travelzoo promotion - double upgrade to a suite for $145/night. We were pretty happy with the room, especially at that price, but if I paid $350 per night like they supposedly used to charge, I would be pretty unhappy. The room had absolutely no view, but we didn't really care. The lobby is very dark, so much so that it took awhile for our eyes to adjust before we could see anything. The staff was okay but we have certainly seen better service at other hotels. For example, our group of seven wanted a drink and there was no room at the bar - which is quite busy late at night, by the way - so we asked if we could buy drinks and drink them in a non-busy area of the lobby that had enough seating for our group. They wouldn't let us do it, and there was no explanation as to why we couldn't. Well, they lost out on about $150 for no good reason, which we ended up spending at the St. Francis down the street. Other than that little issue, we had a nice time and the hotel is centrally located close to theaters and restaurants.
reviews.title: Do NOT even contemplate staying here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Funny one - we arrive for our 3 day stay on a Saturday morning and were asked if we could move "next door" to the Marriott because they were full. In return we would be upgraded to a suite for the remaining 2 nights. We agreed and then were left to lug our baggage to a cab (which we had to pay for!) to get to the Marriott which was about 2 streets away.
reviews.title: Worth a look, but not a stay

reviews.text: When we returned the next day, the room wasn't ready until 3pm. We went out and came back about 6pm, rang through for our bags which took 50 minutes to arrive !! The ipod dock and the TV didn't work and whilst the room was big (with a dinner table set for 8!) the bathroom was small, old and tired (maybe 6ft by 6ft). I dread to think what bathrooms are like in standard rooms! Very disappointing.
reviews.title: DBL Suite - very spacious!!

reviews.text: The hotel decor is very different and its fun and worth a visit to sit on the big chair and see the dark coloured mirrored lifts. Its very trendy and for that reason the staff feel they are a bit above you. I wouldn't rush to stay there again to be honest after the experience of the Bellagio in Vegas, Beverly Wilshire in LA, on the same trip this was the worst :(
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay!

reviews.text: The staff at the Clift Hotel is excellent – always courteous and accommodating! That and the spacious suite made our visit very memorable. The Redwood Room provides an excellent atmosphere to socialize in a classy environment and the overall location of the hotel is amazing – only a few blocks from the best shopping in San Fran!
reviews.title: Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!!!

reviews.text: My friends and I had one of the suites and a double room. The suite was huge with plenty of room to get comfortable in. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge made all of our reservations for us and helped us navigate this huge city. The hotel was located only a couple of blocks from one of the major shopping areas and was just a block from the trolley stop. It was a great location, if you are wanting to experience all parts of San Fran! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone heading to California.
reviews.title: amazing...again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only cofirm what has been commented on on recent reports...the hotel is cool! Decor throughout was excellent... staff friendly and helpful and location excellent I certainly hope to revisit this hotel on my next visit to San francisco
reviews.title: clift, you made our first visit to the west coast complete

likes.liked: — cool decor in the large bedrooms

reviews.text: The hotel is super nice and cool, however the room service appears to be a bit agressive. During my two-week stay there I got two phone calls asking if I want my room cleaned. I was approached with the same question several times in front of the room door and on two occasions room service knocked on my door for the same purpose even with the "do not disturb" sign hanging on the door. Once I noticed my room was cleaned in my absence even though that sign was posted and once the sheets were changed even though I had placed the be-eco-friendly-do-not-change-sheets label on my pillow.
reviews.title: Agressive Room Service

reviews.text: Furthermore the doors and walls are kind of thin so I had the pleasure of listening to the "knock-knock-room-service" routine being played on each door on my floor twice a day. Other reviewers have said the noise in that hotel is mostly from parties, however I think otherwise.
reviews.title: Love the CLIFT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service in a beautiful hotel. I travel regularly in the U.S. and Europe and I find this is one of the best hotels in which I have stayed. The service is consistently first rate by a very attentive staff. Everyone is super friendly, in person and on the phone. They’ve helped me with restaurant reservations, wine-tasting trips, spa reservations, and they do it with pleasure.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Asia de Cuba, the restaurant, has great food, tending towards the deliciously exotic… and the Redwood Room, which must be one of the most beautiful bars in the city, is a great place to have a drink and meet friends or co-workers.
reviews.title: Very nice.
Dark & with a Markup
reviews.text: The Clift lobby was very dark and cool. Staff was always pleasant, but not overly friendly. The PYT's who double as doormen could stand to be a little more attentive (they often failed to open the doors and managed to hail a cab for us that would only go to Oakland - we were headed to Russian Hill!).

The room we had was smallish, but not at all uncomfortable - mirrors almost everywhere helped to maintain the illusion the room was a little bigger than it was. The room was very clean, and the bed and pillows in particular, were super comfortable.
reviews.title: Staff's attitude overshadows beautifully designed hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shower pressure and temperature were perfect - almost too powerful on both counts! And the toiletries provided smelled great and worked well. I'm still using the body milk and hoping to find something comparable.
reviews.title: Satisfied at the Clift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were surprised the Clift charges $10 a day for internet for this high-end of a hotel. Room service is expected to be exhorbitant - but still was much more than expected with extra fees tacked on.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Fantastic Staff!!!

likes.liked: — This hotel has style!!! Very clean, friendly staff.

reviews.text: The location was great though - everywhere we wanted to go was easily accessed on foot or nearby public transportation. I'd be happy to stay at the Clift again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived late with the dreaded news that our room had been inadvertantly double-booked and with an apology and a promise of true compensation, we were chauferred off to the nearby Hilton for the night. The next day upon early check in, the hotel manager himself came to greet and personally escort us to our 'upgrade' - a 3-room luxury suite accompanied by chilled champagne, flowers, a letter of apology , free drinks voucher in their incredible Redwood bar and free breakfasts for the duration of our stay. For the next four days we were treated like royalty in one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. The Asia de Cuba restaurant is superb, the Redwood Bar an experience and our whole stay perfectly memorable. What a difference a great hotel manager can make. Thank you Steven - we will be back!
reviews.title: the difference between good and 'outstanding'

reviews.text: I first stayed here in Nov 05' and came back this time for a quick business trip. The Clift was the only place I wanted to stay b/c of the wonderful experience I had last time. The location was ideal and it has the best lounge in town - Redwood Room.The reviews threw me off a bit as well..but I'm glad that they were WRONG. Contacted the hotel mgr (steven) expressing my concerns, and he responded right away to assure me that I would have a wonderful experience..and he was right! You are greeted at the door w/ handsome gentlemen who open the door for you & will walk you across the street in the rain (Justin). Then you are greeted by a wonderful front office staff who remember your name each time you walk by and smile and always ask if I needed anything. I was traveling by myself, and felt completely safe and content w/ this hotel and staff. The mgr (Matthew) went out of his way to walk me to the Redwood Room, introduce me to the bar staff (Jacqui) who then continued to WOW me w/ their service. Jacqui is full of great ideas to fill up your day...I was more interested in shopping...and she pointed out the best boutiques in the city. She became my go to person each evening I was there for friendly conversation and great cucumber cocktails. So if you consider yourself trendy or chic, like the best of the best, The Clift is the place you want to stay and play. I'll definitely be back for another visit.
reviews.title: Exceeded my Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've read the bad reviews about the Clift, but my husband and I thought it was well-done and actually quite friendly. The staff was happy to chill our champagne, take special care of our luggage, make restaurant reservations for us, set up a special spot in the Redwood Room... really, we were met with smiling faces and competent service on all ends. I thought the design was beautiful even now. And of course- the Redwood Room is worth the spendy drinks!
reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect- stylish and fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited a couple of times late last year while we were in SF. Cool bar, great drinks, big serves.....but LOVED the chair at the front......can you tell......?? Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Great big chair, and great big scallops

reviews.text: An old hotel revamped into a trendy nightspot. Take a torch to find your way to the lift! Upstairs the rooms are large and light. Great location next door to the ACT. I was lucky and got it through Hotwire for $90 a night. At that price it was a bargain, the rack rate less so. Pity as always about the internet charge
reviews.title: Funky, fun and I was lucky and got it cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I travel often so we have definitely seen the good, the bad and the ugly as far as hotels are concerned and I must say that the Clift exceeded our expectations. From the moment we arrived we were treated with warmth and kindness by every staff member we encountered. All of the guys working at the hotel are not only friendly but also easy on the eyes! We loved the decor of lobby and our room and I must say that the Red Room Bar was really swanky, sure a martini is $15.00 but hey, you only live once! This was our first time to San Francisco and definitely will not be the last. The hotel itself is close to everything and anything you would possibly want to do in this city, public transportation is just steps away and cabs are abundant. We did all the tourist stuff, went to Castro, Chinatown and Alcatraz but the highlight of our trip was the Sunday T-Dance called Fresh at Ruby Skyee which is once a month and conveniently enough located right around the corner from the Clift, if you want to party with the boys this is the place to go! We loved the Clift and will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Loved the Clift Hotel
Trendy but lame
reviews.text: I was only at the Clift for a night with my husband and we like fun, trendy hotels but I must say, this hotel is NOT worth it! We booked a larger room on hotels.com and I would hate to see what the smaller, less expensive room would have looked like. This room was TINY, we had a view of a building wall and the guy at the front desk that checked us in was a total cheeseball who thought he was really important. I asked him if we had a nice room, trying to make conversation and he responded with some sarcastic, rude comment. Not to mention to park your car here is $50 a night, plus tax of $7. I know San Francisco is expensive but I think $57 to park overnight is slightly absurd. We had dinner reservations at the restaurant in the hotel, Asia De Cuba, which I will say was fantastic, the Redwood Room bar is cool too, we had a drink there before dinner. Barely got a seat at 7:00pm. We went to some other places after dinner and went back to the Redwood Room and it was totally packed and if we wanted to sit then we would have to order a bottle of vodka. Um, no thanks. I like modern hotels, but this was done in poor taste, looked cheap, the bed was horrifically uncomfortable and the entire hotel is dark. Don't stay here, its not worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this hotel from the moment we arrived. The staff are extremely friendly and loved the design of the rooms, lobby and lounge (Redwood Room). The hotel is really close to Union Square. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in downtown San Fran

reviews.text: A few freinds and I were staying at a friends house outside of San Francisco for Easter Break and we decided last minute to spend a night in San Francisco and the first hotel we could book was the clift, There were 6 of us in the room, which was abnormally large, but college students with meagre ration have little choice. The clift is ideally located for a fun filled night out in gay San Francisco
reviews.title: One Night at the Clift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love this hotel. Love the decor, the staff, the food, the location. We've stayed at three different places in SF whenever we go, and this is always our favorite. The music is soothing, the staff attentive, the room spacious and clean. SF at it's best.
reviews.title: Perfection at it's best

description: An inspired fusion of old-world hotel elegance with distinctly contemporary energy and glamour, the nearly century-old CLIFT’s modern and daring sense of diversity perfectly captures the city’s spirit. Steps from Union Square shopping and the legendary Nob Hill, CLIFT is perfectly located for sightseeing, shopping and socializing. Designed by Philippe Starck, the soaring lobby contains one of the most eclectic furniture collections in all of California
